review_title: I worked with some really good people
pros: I lived working for Citibank. I started out at the 399 Park Avenue Branch as a teller and eventually worked myself up to Personal Banking Officer. I met some great people and I learned a LOT! I had fun and I worked very hard. The branch where I stated out had a daycare below so I was able to leave my son when I did not take him to his regular day care. They give you between 30 to sixty days a year to leave your child which I think is a huge plus. At first I was super nervous but then I got promoted the next year which made me question why I decided to take up a job as a notary public and a customer service officer. the benefits were great and if you get a supervisor to like you you move up very fast. Just be yourself. I had great bosses and some of them were not very nice to other people but they were nice to me. Learn as much as you can from anyone including the source and Citihelp.
cons: You will meet some very mean people and try to avoid them until you find out what is really bothering them. The one problem and greatest problem why I left was when my son got sick, was in the hospital. I had vacation time and I was told by Human resources that I could not get FMLA time off because I had only been there for less than 1 year. I could not believe my ears. I started in 2005 and and this happened in 2012. I could not take time off to take care of my kid and no matter how much I explained and tried to point out the massive mistake/error or deliberate act, they didn't listen. To say I was furious, very anxious and livid would be an understatement. On October 17th 2012, I quietly walked out of 401 west 42nd street, never to return. To add insult to injury, 1 month later I received a UPS letter from the manager, not from Human resources or the Area Director, telling me that because of the few days that I was out, even though I had vacation days, I was being terminated because I did not return or report to work, which was a huge lie. I never received an exit interview. This ladies and gentlemen is what and error or a deliberate act on the part of someone behind a computer can do to you. I say this with no malice because it is only the truth. I guess someone had a vendetta. I liked my job and I liked my coworkers even though they were a pain sometimes. There were things happening that Senior management, those behind the scenes knew about and did not want to speak about it or knew that the only way they could what they wanted was if I specifically moved out of the way. I have not since applied for a job there nor do I think I will ever again because what happened to me should never, ever happen to anyone else.
